title: Add regex section
body:
It would be nice to have _Regular Expressions_ section into style guide.

Useful informations:
- what form to use when write regex
- variable declarations with regex
- when to use and when to avoid regex

Thanks in advance.

title: Add "breathing room" to "whitespace" section
body: Something I picked up from @codetothepoint, leaving "breathing room" around the contents of parameters. I think it adds a lot horizontal readability.

title: Concatenation examples are now equivalent
body: Minor typo fix.

title: javascript style guides in bulgarian
body:
style guides translated to bulgarian language. 
Can't see the flag only

title: Changed russian translation
body:
translation added by @sbezludny contains huge amount grammar mistakes, non-translated terms and was inconsistent in terms translation. 
Uprock translation was corrected and extended based upon junior developers review and proofreaded later as expected to be used as corporate javascript style guide.

title: Eval statement
body: Can we put in a small paragraph that warns against the use of eval with a few reasons why please.

title: Added French translation to the list
body: I didn't edit the licence on my translation, please tell me if I should.

title: Remove invalid name - Naming Conventions
body: In naming conventions `var this-is-my-object = {};` is given as an example of a bad name. But this is an invalid name in Javascript. I dont think it is needed since its a syntax error and an invalid name in the first place.

title: Numbers casting: in current chrome parseInt works much faster then bitshift
body:
According to mentioned in article: http://jsperf.com/coercion-vs-casting/3

![Screenshot](http://dl.dropbox.com/u/932526/Github/20131117-191707.png)

And this test http://jsperf.com/best-of-string-to-number-conversion/10 shows same results.

title: removing the attachment to the 'this' object of the private variables
body:
Hi @hshoff,
Don't you think that binding a private variable to the this object makes the variable/property be public? Although the name makes it obscured, a new team member could access to these members and change them directly. It'd be better to deny that possibility.
http://javascript.crockford.com/private.html

title: Added a part about equals aligment
2 whitespaces ?
body:
The most popular coding standard for PHP (applicable to other langages in differents levels) is clear: **4 spaces**

**_There is only one possible conclusion: Something's wrong in the matrix.**_

What about your thing here:

``` javascript
var items        = getItems(),
    dragonball   = 'z',
    goSportsTeam = true;
```

I count 4 spaces. 4, of course, because `"var ".length` is 4.

title: Lots of overlap between airbnb JavaScript & Idiomatic JS - perhaps merge?
body:
[Idiomatic.JS](https://github.com/rwaldron/idiomatic.js), derived from the JQuery style guidelines, is already a popular style with a _lot_ of contribution from the wider JS community - the airbnb guide seems quite similar but a little shorter. 

There's good stuff in each that is missing from the other.

Both guides have been widely translated, but into a different set of languages. 

Could it be worth merging the airbnb styleguide into Idiomatic? Or vice versa?

Just a thought.

title: Why should strings be ' ' and not " "?
Bitshift performance vs 64bit numbers
body:
Every number is stored with 64bit, except you are doing bit shifting. Then javascript stores the number into a 32bit integer. The result of this: You get negative or just wrong numbers when you are shifting a big js-representing integer.
If you really think bit shift is a good way to improve performance, make sure the numbers are not bigger than 32 bit.

title: Add .jshintrc config file to be compliant with conventions
body: I think that would be a good idea to create a .jshintrc config file to describe all these conventions.

title: Why does JavaScript need a style guide?
body:
One of my favorite parts about the JavaScript community is that people choose to write it in so many different ways.

Why do you want to ruin that with a style guide? 

Imagine if when Picasso was learning to paint, we told him what style he should paint in. Would we have cubism?

title: Mighty Spring is using this style guide!
body:
We're already conforming to all of these standards, except for leading commas ;) Thanks for the great guide!

Please add us to your list! http://www.mightyspring.com

title: Leading Commas
body: This is more of a personal preference than anything else. Of course, you're free to implement whatever you'd like, but declaring leading commas as unilaterally "bad" is disingenuous and misleading (no pun intended). Leading commas definitely have their pros as much as trailing commas have their cons.

title: Update README.md
body: always define your variables at the top. defining them elsewhere is confusing because of hoisting. there is no block scope in javascript.

title: Note on the "Don't use reserved words as keys"
The boolean "good" casting could be better
Optimization and consistency for the string example
Format object array to conform to whitespace guidelines
body:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#whitespace 

>  Place 1 space before the leading brace.

I believe it applies here. Also slimmed down the indent to 2 characters.
